snippet: The conservative majority laid down a cache of weapons for future courts to attack legislative achievements of the New Deal and the Great Society and to prevent new progressive legislation.
abstract: Op-Ed article by public interest law Prof Pamela S Karlan contends that in upholding the health care law, the Supreme Court's conservative majority also laid down a cache of weapons for future courts to attack legislative achievements of the New Deal and the Great Society and to prevent new progressive legislation; warns that the decision was the latest in a series that show the Roberts court has intensified its efforts to reduce federal power.
lead_paragraph: The conservative majority laid down a cache of weapons for future courts to attack legislative achievements of the New Deal and the Great Society and to prevent new progressive legislation.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
